Class AnimatorContext

extends java.lang.Object

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  AnimatorContext.Scene
      A scene owns an animator context and should contain a collection of related views where tracking and coordinating animation life-cycles is useful.
      static class  AnimatorContext.Transaction
      A pending collection of animators that will be run together within a containing animator context.
      static interface  AnimatorContext.TransactionConsumer
      A functor that takes a AnimatorContext.Transaction instance, and adds animators to it.
      static interface  AnimatorContext.TransactionOptions

    • Field Detail

      • DEBUG

        public static boolean DEBUG
        Whether or not stack-traces should be printed when beginAnimation(String) and endAnimation(String) are called. Provided for debugging dangling animations.

    • Method Detail

      • runWhenIdle

        public void runWhenIdle(java.lang.Runnable task)
        Posts a unit of work to run when the context is idle.

        The task will be immediately executed if the animation context is currently idle.

        Parameters:
        task - The task.

      • startWhenIdle

        public void startWhenIdle(android.animation.Animator animator)
        Schedules an animator to start when the animator context is idle next.
        Parameters:
        animator - The animator to start.

      • beginAnimation

        public void beginAnimation(java.lang.String name)
        Increment the active animation counter, potentially bringing the animator context into the active state.

        Animation tracking is implemented as a counter instead of tracking animator instances to allow interactive transitions to be treated as active animations within a context. E.g. this can be used to prevent unwanted animations from running when a user is swiping between elements on a screen.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the animation, used for debugging.

      • endAnimation

        public void endAnimation(java.lang.String name)
        Decrement the active animation counter, potentially bringing the animator context out of the active state. If the counter reaches zero with this call, on the next looper cycle any queued idle tasks will be executed.

        Calling beginAnimation(String) before the next looper cycle will cause those tasks to remain queued.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the animation, used for debugging.
        See Also:
        for rationale behind this API design.

      • bind

        public <T extends android.animation.Animator> void bind(T animator,
                                                        java.lang.String name)
        Binds the animator context to the begin/end animation events of a given animator.

        Important: Bindings are one-shot. So if you plan on re-using a bound animator, you will need to bind it at the beginning of each use.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the animator.
        Parameters:
        animator - The animator to bind.
        name - The name of the animator.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if animator is annotated NotBindable.
        See Also:
        NotBindable

      • getTransactionTemplate

        public AnimatorTemplate getTransactionTemplate()
        Provides the animator template applied to transactions that don't specify their own.
        Returns:
        The template to apply.

      • setTransactionTemplate

        public void setTransactionTemplate(AnimatorTemplate transactionTemplate)
        Specifies the animator template to apply to transactions that don't specify their own.

        Also used by MultiAnimator.animatorFor(View, AnimatorContext).

        Parameters:
        transactionTemplate - The template to apply.

      • transaction

        public AnimatorContext.Transaction transaction(AnimatorTemplate template,
                                               int options,
                                               AnimatorContext.TransactionConsumer consumer,
                                               OnAnimationCompleted onCompleted)
        Executes a series of animations within the animation context. 
             AnimatorContext context = ...;
     context.transaction(t -> {
         t.animatorFor(oldView).fadeOut(View.GONE);
         t.animatorFor(newView).fadeIn();
     });
        Parameters:
        template - An optional template to apply to animators involved in the transaction.
        options - The options to apply to the transaction.
        consumer - A consumer that will add animators to the transaction.
        onCompleted - An optional listener to invoke when the animators all complete.
        Returns:
        The animator that will execute the transaction. You must not call Animator.start().
        See Also:
        For possible options., For more information on working with a transaction.

      • transaction

        public AnimatorContext.Transaction transaction(AnimatorContext.TransactionConsumer consumer,
                                               OnAnimationCompleted onCompleted)
        Short-hand provided for common use-case.
        Parameters:
        consumer - A consumer that will add animators to the transaction.
        onCompleted - An optional listener to invoke when the animators all complete.
        Returns:
        The animator that will execute the transaction. You must not call Animator.start().
        See Also:
        transaction(AnimatorTemplate, int, TransactionConsumer, OnAnimationCompleted)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: java.lang.Object
        Returns a string containing a concise, human-readable description of this object. Subclasses are encouraged to override this method and provide an implementation that takes into account the object's type and data. The default implementation is equivalent to the following expression: 
           getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())

        See Writing a useful toString method if you intend implementing your own toString method.

        Overrides:
